alert.note: Alert for Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 26 at 5:31PM CST until January 27 at 7:48PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Grounds are well saturated due to prior rainfall over the past few days. This additional rainfall will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pasadena, South Houston, Bellaire, West University Place, Galena Park, Jacinto City, Hunters Creek Village, Bunker Hill Village, Piney Point Village, Downtown Houston, Fourth Ward, Near Northside Houston, Greater Fifth Ward, Midtown Houston, Second Ward, Greater Third Ward, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Eastwood, Greater Heights and Memorial Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
